5EC63130DFE8013110F768A86D17958E.description: Students describe relationships among people and places, and the environmental context in which they take place.

5EC5F210DFE8013110F668A86D17958E.description: Students locate major landmarks, landforms, and areas/regions in the community and in Wyoming

5EC5AEB0DFE8013110F568A86D17958E.description: Students identify their relative location in terms of home, school, neighborhood, community, county, state, country, and continent.

5EC56DC0DFE8013110F468A86D17958E.description: Students use physical maps, political maps, and globes to identify locations using scale, cardinal and intermediate directions, legends, keys, and symbols.

5EC52860DFE8013110F368A86D17958E.description: People, Places, and Environments: Students demonstrate an understanding of interrelationships among people, places, and environments.

5EC4DE90DFE8013110F268A86D17958E.description: Students describe the chronology of exploration, immigration and settlement of Wyoming.

5EC4A1D0DFE8013110F168A86D17958E.description: Students discuss and describe how current events influence individuals, communities, state, country, and/or world.

5EC463C0DFE8013110F068A86D17958E.description: Students identify significant local, state and national persons, holidays, and symbols.

5EC427A0DFE8013110EF68A86D17958E.description: Time, Continuity and Change: Students demonstrate an understanding of the people, events, problems, ideas, and cultures that were significant in the history of our community, state, nation and world.

5EC3E8C0DFE8013110EE68A86D17958E.description: Students describe different ways that people earn a living in the local community and in Wyoming.

5EC3A830DFE8013110ED68A86D17958E.description: Students describe the importance of major resources, industries, and economic development of the local community and Wyoming.

5EC35C90DFE8013110EC68A86D17958E.description: Production, Distribution, and Consumption: Students demonstrate an understanding of economic principles and concepts and describe the influence of economic factors on societies.

5EC31290DFE8013110EB68A86D17958E.description: Students explain how culture is reflected in literature and the arts.

5EC2D030DFE8013110EA68A86D17958E.description: Students describe how human needs and concerns (i.e. freedom, justice, and responsibility) are addressed within cultures.

5EC28E10DFE8013110E968A86D17958E.description: Culture/Cultural Diversity: Students demonstrate an understanding of different cultures and how these cultures have contributed and continue to contribute to the world in which they live.

5EC24C50DFE8013110E868A86D17958E.description: Students explain how rules and laws affect families, schools, communities, and states.

5EC208B0DFE8013110E768A86D17958E.description: Students describe and apply rights and responsibilities of citizenship.

5EC1B560DFE8013110E668A86D17958E.description: Citizenship/Government/Democracy: Students demonstrate how structures of power, authority, and governance have developed historically and continue to evolve.
